title: Plot of data from torque experiment

content.question: A student conducts an experiment to determine the relationship between applied torque and change in angular velocity. The student uses the apparatus shown in the figure above, consisting of two disks that are glued together and mounted on a horizontal axle. Blocks of varying mass are hung from a string wound around the smaller disk. The blocks are released from rest, exerting different torques on the disks, and are allowed to fall a fixed distance. For each block, the time of fall t and the final angular velocity ωf of the disks are measured. There is considerable friction between the disks and the axle. Which of the following best represents a plot that can be obtained from the student’s data?

choices.label: A line of 6 points begins on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin about one-fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, and extends up and to the right ending about halfway up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis.

A line of 8 points begins on the vertical axis above the origin about one fifth of the way up the vertical axis, and extends up and to the right ending near the top of the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis.

A line of 8 points begins at the intersection of the axes, and extends up and to the right ending about three fourths of the way up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis.
A line of 9 points begins about three fourths of the way up, and on the vertical axis, and extends down and to the right ending about three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis.

content.answer: A line of 6 points begins on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin about one-fourth of the way along the horizontal axis, and extends up and to the right ending about halfway up the vertical axis and three fourths of the way along the horizontal axis.
